website_summaries.verdict: The Audioengine 5+ powered speakers deliver excellent sound quality and provide a clutter-free way to listen to smartphones, iPods, or any other audio source.
pros: The Audioengine 5+ powered speakers deliver phenomenal sound and offer simple, attractive styling
They feature two audio inputs and an integrated USB port for charging source devices (phones, iPods)
The two speakers can be placed as far apart as needed to optimize stereo separation
A remote for controlling volume is included
cons: The speakers aren't cheap, and many will find them to be too large and bulky compared with standard PC speakers
The AC power port found in the earlier model is no longer present, and you can't switch between the two inputs--both are always active

customer_reviews.title: Full beautiful sound. Easy blue tooth.
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve been using these for a couple weeks. Most important: they sound rich and full, even streaming from my cell’s Pandora. I hooked them up to my TV and everything sounds full and clear. I do professional sound and projection for a living. I own pro Bose, EV, Mackie, Peavey, Shure gear. In my living room, Audio Engine made the Rock Hall of Fame Induction show ring true. These are in a different class than my old Logitec 2.1 System with the big sub and separate tweeters. It was always missing the rich integrated mids. These AEs hookup easily and look great. I’m not sure why I was living with bad sound at home.
customer_reviews.author: Denise or Mike

customer_reviews.title: and have a surprisingly nice low end for speakers this size
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for new speakers, buy these. I don't regret forking over the 400 bucks. They're articulate, musical, and have a surprisingly nice low end for speakers this size. They won't make your living room rattle, but there's definitely a clarity and oomph to bass lines that you wouldn't expect from relatively small speakers. The thing I can't quite put my finger on is how smooth these speakers sound. I wish I had a better way to describe it. There's just something pleasing about them no matter what is being played. Like bits of music that might otherwise sound harsh just come through like butter. Plus, the bamboo looks killer apart from the great sound!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I probably shouldn't have spent this much on speakers but these sound great!
customer_reviews.text: These are overpriced, in the sense no one should be wasting this much money on only two speakers. But having already bought them, I love them. They are perfect for a turntable and bluetooth set up (which is hard to find/build), so I can play albums one minute and the switch to streaming something off my phone the next. (OR plug in my laptop to play lossless audio files, you can actually tell the difference between file quality on these!) SO do I recommend you buy these? Hell no. Go buy a cheaper pair and spend your money on something more important... but if they magically arrive on your doorstep, you should definitely keep them.
customer_reviews.author: En

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought these.
customer_reviews.text: Did plenty of research for desktop speakers - found these and it's one of the best purchases I've made. Be sure to buy the Bass Cabinet, well worth the additional investment, it'll change your life. My home office/studio is about 16' x 20' with a high ceiling. I listen to music only, no YouTube and no gaming. Just LOUD music. I listen to a lot of Rock, Prog Rock, Jazz and some Classical. EDM is insane. Took my set up a couple of months to really get the sweet resonance from this trio.
customer_reviews.author: The Riz

customer_reviews.title: fabulous, creamy sound
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best computer speakers in the world - certainly the best I have come across. Fabulous reproduction of sound across the whole spectrum, and respectable bass too. Easily match in quality bookshelf speakers from many manufacturers at twice the price (and size). I was so impressed, a little while later I purchased their sub, which I also love. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: I was not expecting such sound from two speakers like this. I was considering buying another sub woofer ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was not expecting such sound from two speakers like this. I was considering buying another sub woofer setup to replace my old Monsoon setup I had but I really did not want that stupid woofer getting in the way of everything. I knew I would be sacrificing the big bass but was hoping against hope that these would sound good enough on their own. As I said, I was really shocked. They sound incredible! Very crisp and really good bass for what they are. They do not take up much space at all. If you are on the fence for some really outstanding speakers for your computer, these are the ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers, bigger than I thought though.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too hung up on audio as far as other essentials go, but I recently decided to buy these speakers for a PC upgrade and it ended up being one of the best buys I made in a while. The audio is so much clearer than my previous speakers. My only warning is that you pay attention to that actual size of these speakers if you are planning on buying these for your pc. These speakers are about twice the size as normal front facing speakers you put on your desk so if you have the room it I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb B.

customer_reviews.title: Not working after just more than a year
customer_reviews.text: not working after just more than a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Breaks within a week
customer_reviews.text: The left speaker of this unit broke within 3 days of play, and, after being installed and not otherwise touched (we use bluetoth) the unit now emits a horrifying buzzing sound that drowns out all music. In fact, it buzzes horrifyingly if it just happens to be on and not receiving input. Great design, great audio engineering, pretty miserable on the manufacturer's QA. I'll be talking to the manufacturer and amazon to see who wants this dead left speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Joachim

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: I wouldnt buy these again. Ready to return them. First they forgot the speaker cable to connect the right from left speaker. Fine. I went out and bought some because I want my things to work. The right speaker only had sound coming from the tweeter. So I figured id wait until audioengine sent me the correct speaker cable. Received the speaker cable and again can barely get sound out of the right speaker. Ive tried everything on the website. Only sound comes out of the tweeter. The left speaker is fine. I feel as if I have a faulty right speaker and im disappointed. These were alot of money
customer_reviews.author: Rj digi

customer_reviews.title: My PC A/V experience is out of this world now!
customer_reviews.text: I am no audiophile, but I wanted a nice set of desktop speakers instead of the 10 year old freebies that I got with a PC purchase. I took the plunge by ordering these and a DAC from Schiit Audio (Modi 2). I set them up above my desk using these speaker mounts from VideoSecu ( This completes my computer setup in my bedroom, which doubles as my entertainment center. Since installing them, I have enjoyed a great improvement in my experience watching movies and listening to music across the room. The soundstage is quite a step up from the junk I had in the past, and the clarity is impressive. I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Poor shielding
customer_reviews.text: I own a few pairs of studio monitors, and picked these up for more casual listening. The shielding on these is horrible. It picks up interference which causes static and other noises. Unless you're in love with this particular design, which I do admit is very nice, look at the KRK Rokit 5 series. They sound are built better.
customer_reviews.author: inhalexhale

customer_reviews.title: Extremely High Quality, Great Bass and Sound
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can't recommend these speakers enough. I did MONTHS of research and even bought/returned a few products before settling on these. I was mostly worried about bass and have been extremely pleased with the bass on these (I listened to lots of alt/electronic). The quality of the speakers themselves are amazing and they seem very high end. I use these for vinyl + digital and enjoy both experiences. The remote is convenient but not the most sensitive. Overall 9/10 and would absolutely recommend these to anyone looking for a sub $500 speaker setup!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wojtila

customer_reviews.title: but pretty dang good sounding speakers
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat expensive, but pretty dang good sounding speakers! Reasonably loud. But After a year or two, I think I now have a slight buzz on one, so don't blow them up ;) My feeling is for the money, they should have been able to handle more throughput. I have other, smaller 3" speakers made by JVC which are played louder, and have lasted me for years without blowing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Perry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: First off, unboxing this was great. Everything was well packaged and comes in solid microfiber bags for extra protection. They look great and are built very solid. You’ll notice the weight, especially out of the powered left speaker. I got these in white and they’re definitely a focal point in the living room. Setup was easy. The instructions are simple to follow. No issues there whatsoever. These speakers sound fantastic. We bought these for a new turntable but that or the preamp hasn’t arrived yet so I just plugged my phone right in with the included cables and the sound is unreal. I had high expectations but was blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They were amazing at first
customer_reviews.text: These speaker look amazing and sounded amazing for the 1st year and a half. Now they make a weird crackling noise when nothing is playing on them. I've replaced all the cables and tried keeping certain things unplugged and moved them to see if it was some sort of interference in the location they were. Nothing worked. I am very disappointed that I spent all this money on speakers only for them to start working like crap...... I feel like there are better speakers out there.
customer_reviews.author: John Sugzdinis

customer_reviews.title: Too much mid-range, narrow, and thin.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these. They are built very well, they are packaged very well, but to me they sound too thin, too much narrow mid-range (tin can). Occasionally I'd find a track that suited them well, and they'd sound excellent, but for the price I really expect more. For now I'll have to stick with my Edirol MA-15D for my office speakers that these A5s were supposed to replace. Music selection: mostly rock, blues rock, and progressive metal, but new age, and occasional classical as well.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, and then they broke down after one year...
customer_reviews.text: I got everything I thought I needed for these speakers: good cables, a subwoofer and a preamp. I use them with my computer. Installation was simple enough, but volume control is an issue: you can not control it from the computer, the remote is very fuzzy and there is no volume level indicator. They definitely do not perform acceptably without a preamp, but even so, the sound is flat and lifeless. And then, after a little over a year of ocasional light use, the passive speaker stop working. Not what you expect from a $400 pair of speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Wolsey

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, but perhaps too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with these, but I guess expected a little more for the money. I am used to and very fond of B&W in general, so these are a little more on a reference level side. These speakers reproduce music as it is, no magic, no extra warmth. I guess price was forcing me to want more... Still very good pair though. Can't complain about anything in particular
customer_reviews.author: enemyofthesame

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, needs better remote/connections
customer_reviews.text: Not that these need anymore reviews from users or audiophile outlets. But the sound on these things live up the hype. Only thing they could improve on is a few more connection options on the rear. Also a more robust remote with the ability to adjust audio levels or input channels would also be great. Have already lost this tiny remote 3 times, only owned it 2 days!! Chromecast audio which I use, has a built-in equilizer which allows you to adjust the sound as a work around to the above mentioned issue. Just wish there was a digital input option for my TV like optical or HDMI. A sub definitely rounds the sound out on these things nicely.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Left speaker unreliable
customer_reviews.text: These speakers look and sound great, but the left unit has stopped working several times. When I contacted support they instructed me to take the unit apart and "while music is playing, gently wiggle all the wires back and forth while listening". Pushing a wire around did fix the issue at first, but it has now stopped working again. I may try to open it up again and play around more, but overall I'm disappointed in the build quality for this to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Desktop iMac
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly floored from the sound just using the pin connector on my iMac , I hear instruments and sounds I never heard before in digital music . I haven’t turned them up yet since they are a few days le and they need to go through a 40-50 hour “Break In “ period as I was instructed by Audio Engine Rep . Extremely happy With the purchase for my current set up .
customer_reviews.author: innocenzo j ciorra

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers, exquisite sound
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are a thing of beauty. I have them in a mid-size kitchen / living room / dining room and they sound fantastic. So nice to have great sound without having to mess with the amplifier etc. The speakers play primarily jazz from old cassette tapes (family heirlooms at this point) and they manage to make even that source sound musical. I would absolutely buy them again for a similar application.
customer_reviews.author: KEF

customer_reviews.title: Solid bookshelf speakers.
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic little speakers and they pack a punch. Solid construction and they look sharp. Bluetooth works great. One thing to know: proper placement is the key. I get good low end from these when placed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: etwotimes

customer_reviews.title: Very Neutral but Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I’m not audiophile. Having said that, I wanted a very neutral speaker with high quality sound and I got that with these for my computer music. My ears are in their sixties and missing some areas of hearing. With a computer speaker, listening to music doesn’t have to be that loud, but they are certainly capable of that. I might want to add a small sub-woofer for a little bass coloring on the low spectrum in the future. For me, it was almost a case of be careful what you ask for, but I will keep them. Very neutral IMO.
customer_reviews.author: John Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: These are really great
customer_reviews.text: These are really great! I was going to get the Audioengine Subwoofer as well, but decided to wait and see how these sound. The Sub is not needed. I'm impressed with the spectrum of sound these produce, deep strong bass and super clear mids and highs. They are also loud as heck! Love these... still may get the Sub, but that's just because I'm feeling greedy for more bass.
customer_reviews.author: twarnick

customer_reviews.title: Much better sound than a soundbar
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using a soundbar for awhile and really wanted better sound. These are amazing - I also bought a $600 new soundbar at the same time (Yamaha) but these blew that out of the water. Like night and day, no contest. They're a bit big + boxy vs. the sexy thinner box, which is my only negative, but I got the angled speaker stands and have them just under my desk on my computer tower + an old black tower box from a speaker. I also had an external sub already that I just attached, it really helps to fill out the bass as others have said. It's not audioengine's, any powered sub will probably be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Watt

customer_reviews.title: Brilliantly amazed by premium product with premium sound! Look amazing too!
customer_reviews.text: This is like falling in love with music all over again! Rock, Metal, Hip Hop, Hair Metal(my fav) classical and even the new stuff kids call “trap”. This speaker set has set me apart from regular audio enthusiasts! The sound is crisp, solid, deep, low, high! amazing all around regardless of your music preference. I am just stunned and hitting myself because I did not for this any sooner! I recommend the Bluetooth version and the 8in sub is a must yo get the full effect. Don’t delay any longer, get this now! Feel the music the real way it was intended!
customer_reviews.author: Vicente Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: great desktop speakers to hook up to a computer
customer_reviews.text: i love these speakers. have them hooked up to my desktop mac, replacing my old JBL speakers with subwoofer. these speakers blow my old jbl speakers off the planet. great definition to the music, good base, everything i could ask for in a desktop speaker. bought the stands that are available which definitely make the speakers sound better. if you are looking to upgrade your computer speakers you can't go wrong with these...very happy with my purchase. you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jjb

customer_reviews.title: While quality headphones are great, i missed speakers
customer_reviews.text: When i moved, i had damaged my Klipsch 2.1 desktop speaker set, and had been using headphones with a DAC/amp for quite a while. While quality headphones are great, i missed speakers. I also didn't want to bug my neighbors downstairs with booming bass from a big sub, and these fit the bill perfectly. They still have some decent bass but nothing thats going to shake your walls (or floors). They get stupid loud and stay clear. Even on crappy media sources you will hear things you never heard before. Good packaging and build quality. So far so good, just need to break them in. Oh, and kind of silly, but they also look great sitting on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: w123

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't reached the "50+" hours Audioengine said to wait before evaluating "critical" music. They don't have the oompf of my (1970s) Advent floor speakers so far. But I really enjoy begin able to use just a turntable and the speakers or just the CD player and the speakers without needing my pre-amp or amp from 1973. That makes the stuff much more portable, and needs fewer power outlets. I don't try to vibrate the windows anymore, so the 50W per channel and bookshelf speaker configuration should work just fine. All in all I'm pleased I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Married Man

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Wow! The sound quality out of these speakers is absolutely fantastic! The build quality is sturdy and looks great. The clarity of the speakers is fantastic as is the low end. Even though I have a sub, I used the crossfade to put more low end onus on the speakers, just to see how they would do and they were great! I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Splinter76

customer_reviews.title: Speechless
customer_reviews.text: What can I say.. These speakers are amazing. At first i was a bit skeptical that I would not my money's worth, but boy was I wrong! They've blown me away. The amount of clarity present in every frequency in the music I'm listening to is just amazing! I'm able to hear melodies that were muffled before with my last speakers, which were Logitech Z623. Don't get me wrong, those were a good pair, but a bit to bass heavy. I didn't opt for the subs and am every happy! I mostly listen to electronic music so they fit my application very well!
customer_reviews.author: florit

customer_reviews.title: listening to my favorite music from Corrine Bailey Rae -Trouble Sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I just set it up to my notebook computer in about 5 minutes. I bought this as an early BD present for myself. listening to my favorite music from Corrine Bailey Rae -Trouble Sleeping , Emma Louise - Stainache, Zoe Johnston - Alchemy, In Search of Sunrise Dubai - Richard Durand, w/ Lange, Bon Iver (Blindsided , For Emma) , Shakey Graves (Alejandro Rose Garcia) -(Only Son, House of Winston) , and finally Porter - Athemahawke -bailando con..,Cuervos, etc.) . Great Speakers, really did an outstanding job reproducing the acoustic-electric- mix of highs and lows in Shakey Graves and Porter's music. Emma Louise's vocals were nice and separated from the synth pop - acoustic music.
customer_reviews.author: carlos rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I love my new A5+ wireless
customer_reviews.text: I love my new A5+ wireless! I looked online at other wireless speakers with the same features, but found these to be the "best bang for the buck". Audioengine has a Bluetooth receiver, but I wanted the connectivity in the speakers... well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, but there are serious issues
customer_reviews.text: The volume knob is glitchy all the time. Unacceptable for what I paid for this set of speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: These were never that impressive, but they have finally given out on me. The light on the front blinks when in sleep mode, which is super annoying. I also would have preferred a digital input. The bluetooth has finally stopped working for me. None of my devices can pair after power-cycling the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingMan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound from relatively small speaker size
customer_reviews.text: Setup on Windows 10 PC was very cumbersome. Audioengine Instructions on that type of set up was very minimal and of no help. That should be improved. Audio quality for the size of speakers and with no dedicated woofer is excellent. USB ports are in the rear of one of the speakers which is not very convenient. But overall, excellent sound quality and value particularly for speakers that will be used in limited space environments.
customer_reviews.author: wayne marion

customer_reviews.title: The best computer speakers.
customer_reviews.text: In my 25+ years of listening to music on the computer, the A5+ have been the best computer speakers by far.
customer_reviews.author: Ojunico

customer_reviews.title: These are really good speakers and they get loud for sure
customer_reviews.text: These are really good speakers and they get loud for sure! I use them for computer and I definitely wanted some that had a small remote for when I was in bed, the only problem with that is that you have to point them directly at the master receiver or it won't work very well. Also one problem that I have noticed that did not exist with my last speakers, is that if I set my phone next to them you can hear a good amount of static and it is very annoying unless I move my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Bruns

customer_reviews.title: The Sound is EXQUISITE
customer_reviews.text: These Speakers take Six months to break in. They are beyond AWESOME sound !!! i've had these just over six months and you can tell the sound difference from when you first get them turned on and the quality six months later.
customer_reviews.author: Majik Imaje

customer_reviews.title: Long range Bluetooth very crisp and clear
customer_reviews.text: The quality and design of my new A5+ Wireless speakers are top notch! I read about the extended range of the Bluetooth but had no idea until I tested them 100ft away using my phone as the source and they still have clear crisp sound. Definitely worth the money plus Audioengine has a 3 year warranty. Highly recommend these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: robert armington

customer_reviews.title: Great powered monitors
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding and great looking speakers. They are airy and open for vocals, mids and highs. The bass is nice and tight, however if you're looking for the low thump and shake, you will need to add a sub. Think of these as great monitors for a small to medium size room. I'm using these with their Bluetooth module to stream from my phone and connected to my PC at work (private lab space). Unless you have a private office, these will be too big for most cubicle areas.
customer_reviews.author: Roy G.

customer_reviews.title: I use these as computer speakers and I like them. They hit hard though FYI
customer_reviews.text: I use these as computer speakers and I like them. They hit hard though FYI, they might be a bit much. If you're concerned about bass, and think you might need a subwoofer to go with these, let me assure you that you don't. These things are massive and pack a punch, I think honestly a little too much. I sincerely can't say these are worth the price you pay for them either. I'll keep them just because, but some of the other options for 100 or 200 bucks seem like they would be just as good for the price if you're looking for computer speakers only.
customer_reviews.author: Sattva

customer_reviews.title: Returned because of constant low static noise coming out of them
customer_reviews.text: There was a constant low static sound coming out of speakers. Unplugged from computer same thing. Tried different power outlets on the UPS - same. I went back to using my Klipsch speakers which do not have this problem. Shame because the bass and sound stage were nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: Best Desktop speakers for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say that for the price I can't imagine another speaker could out perform the A5+s! They are fully broken-in now and are a wonder to listen to. I did my research and could not be more happy with my purchase, I connected my Acoustech H-100 12" powered sub and it's amazing. My next purchase will be the Audioengine D1 24-bit Digital-to-Ana​log Converter so my FLAC files will sound even better on these beauties! Unless your one of those SELF proclaimed audiophiles with $2,500 speaker cables you won't regret the A5+s!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, should have Bluetooth or Alexa/AirPlay
customer_reviews.text: They’re decent, attractive speakers for the price. I feel they should definitely have Bluetooth and Alexa or airplay in them for this price point. Wish they went to sleep on their own as the light is either always on or blinking
customer_reviews.author: Xen Tsiu

customer_reviews.title: 5 years of daily use later, still sounding great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these speakers for 5 years now. I use them daily for blasting music, as well as using them as general computer speakers. No complaints whatsoever. The music sounds amazing.
customer_reviews.author: mewtwo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These things are insane for their size. I have a decent sized living room and I can't come close to turning these up all the way. Clarity is absolutely perfect at any level. Bass is impressive. Can't see any need for an external sub. So far I'm thrilled with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B Antonich

customer_reviews.title: A source of joy
customer_reviews.text: Could these be any more beautiful... I put on a wide variety of things and I felt like I was almost in the room with those that had real instruments. But since the majority of music I listen to has synthetic instruments, I listened to more of that, and it was still amazing. I LOVE these speakers and they have given me much joy, and they shall continue to do so for hopefully a very long time. NO cons whatsoever, just close my eyes and enjoy the music... (and tear up more often than not...)
customer_reviews.author: Dracaemelos

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I've been listening to these bamboo speakers for two days. So far so good. With D1 DAC, the sound is clear whiteout any electric background noise. I'm not game person and I love vocals, so bass is good enough to me. Before I bought these, I also considered Vanatoo Transparent One. It was hard to make a decision since I'd never listened to both. But I had A2+ for two years. It worked pretty well. So I trust Audioengine and bought A5+with D1. It doesn't disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Clover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers. I've had these speakers for about a ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speakers. I've had these speakers for about a year now. The speakers sound really crisp with great imagining. They look cool in flat black. They are solid, big and bulky They lack mid range compared to Revel Performa3 f208s Vocals are super crisp. Great build quality, but lackluster design. Powerful and loud Generally clear, transparent bookshelf speakers with a punch. There's a remote, and it sucks. It's a 1/2 credit card sized jellybutton remote. Super cheap quality remote that works but is disappointing given the quality of the speakers. Charge a few bucks more and provide a solid remote.
customer_reviews.author: mobi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Paired with my ION pro turntable with an AT-740ML cartridge these things rock. Paired easily to the Turntable, plenty of speaker wire for good separation between the speakers. Heavy, clean, crisp and plenty powerful enough to wake the neighbors. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rummell

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these speakers long ago. Buying 80 90 $100 speakers trying to save money actually cost me money in the long run these speakers are absolutely phenomenal. Playing world of tanks, I actually scared myself a couple of times lol, had the volume up a little to much the explosions sounded realistic! You won't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are great speakers. Now I have good sound while I work at home on my computer. In the past, if I really wanted to listen to music, I would take the CD to the stereo in the den and listen - a lot of my music just sounded like crap on the speakers that I had on the computer. Sure, it could handle blasting rock and roll, but anything with a real dynamic range was just pitiful. Now I can listen to whatever I want. Can't say enough good things about these. They are clean and tight, both in looks and sound.
customer_reviews.author: lisle_g

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound awesome, they have clear mediums and a clear bass, the construction of the music scene is outstanding. No concerns at all, if the most important feature for you is the sound quality this could be one of the best options. It's very difficult to find something negatives about these speakers, but if there is something, I would say that the included remote control is useless, everything else is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Comprando Ando

customer_reviews.title: Very happy and a good product for its price
customer_reviews.text: Oh my damm! Was the first words that i said when i played my first song on them they come in crisp and so clean with enough bass to feel it when your 8 ft away, one thing i was worried was the bass factor i like 'bassy' songs and these bad boys definitely keep up they are just really clean sounding and go up so loud your yelling to talk, for the record they do still sound just as crisp and clean when maxed out but they are over the top loud if you do max them out
customer_reviews.author: Cody idzikowski

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but I don't regret my purchase at all.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are freakin' great. LED indicates whether the device is on or hibernating. Materials feel of a high quality and the design is pleasing to the eye. If you pair this with theyou'll have a great experience and the subwoofer conveniently has an electrical plug that can be used as pass-through for the speakers to ensure cleaner cable management. The included remote (although rarely used by me) was also a welcome addition to have.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding and beautiful on my desk
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding and beautiful on my desk. So far the sound is very balanced. The base is sufficient (definitely not boomy) but doesn't extend as low as larger speakers. But for a pair of powered bookshelf units I haven't heard better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaevitz

customer_reviews.title: Solid speakers
customer_reviews.text: One of my all time favorite speakers regardless of size or power situation. If you need a lot of sound in a very small room these might work but for large areas, don't expect really big sound, these are pretty small speakers physically but produce fantastic sound. I actually use them in my garage/workshop and they are stellar sounding for that purpose. At really loud levels the amp gets warm has never overheated to the point of tripping out or clipping the sound. I have some gen 2 SONOS Play 5's and I think these sound every bit as good for about half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Cool

customer_reviews.title: Great sound when accompanied by a good subwoofer.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound excellent - when they are augmented by a good subwoofer. I’m using an SVS SB-1000 for this purpose. Without a subwoofer, the bass is lacking. They are well-built, and very attractive. I’m glad I purchased them
customer_reviews.author: kelly londry

customer_reviews.title: They work fine and sound OK
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with these speakers. They work fine and sound OK. However, the exceptional sound portrayed in the reviews is overstated. Pros: Small Good volume Lotta bass, whole lotta bass Well packed with lots of box candy. Well built and priced fair Cons Lotta bass, a whole lotta bass. Too much bass to really enjoy vinyl or low volume listening. By the time tonal balance is reached these speakers are pretty loud. Too loud for an apartment. Not enough inputs to use without another pc of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: and I am shocked by just how nice and tight the grain looks and is finished out
customer_reviews.text: This speaker package is visually STUNNING and extremely well made! I paid more to get the bamboo, and I am shocked by just how nice and tight the grain looks and is finished out... like fine furniture! The speakers come packed separately in their own cloth bags, as does the extras: all of the better-quality cables that they supply with your purchase :) The sound? Well... it's FANTASTIC! A huge, wide, warn soundstage with a full range of you to enjoy. Music that you've heard for years will suddenly expose SO much more vibrance and urgency to you. An EASY rating for me... 5 Stars! I love 'em! ;)
customer_reviews.author: F. Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Two big blocks of gut-rumbly sound clarity
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my U-Turn Orbit Plus and they are amazing. I’m hearing a lot more to my music than I had previously been aware was on the record. They also fill a room quite nicely and have plenty of bass. I will probably by a pair of A2+ soon for my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cabezon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from some Edifier's to these. Not disappointed in the slightest. Such rich and amazing sound. Crisp audio for videos and gaming alike. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Buffon

customer_reviews.title: ... the corners of my desk I really started to like them. As transparent as I could ask for
customer_reviews.text: Once I got used to the size of these bookshelf speakers living on the corners of my desk I really started to like them. As transparent as I could ask for, great response, and none of that fooling around with the signal which other (returned!) speakers at this price range tend to do. Would I buy them again if I had to? Oh heck yeah. Love these things, especially with the S8 subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Got people dancing!
customer_reviews.text: I don't often spend money on audio-equipment, I am simple guy and have been living with two small PC speakers for years. However, as I was having a birthday party, and hoped to get people to dance, I decided to spend some money to get good sound. And I did! These two rather small boxes play loud and well! Installation took me 15 minutes w/o any issues, turned it on and full bodied sound filled my room. Probably not good enough for an audiophile but for me excellent. And people danced until the early morning!
customer_reviews.author: Runar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Sonics
customer_reviews.text: As a audiophile, I'm picky about the way my systems sound. The 5+ speakers are exceptional ! Quick and accurate. Well made and superbly finished. Even packaged impressively ! Certainly worth the money !
customer_reviews.author: G.F

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound
customer_reviews.text: Makes you want to listen to every song you own again. I am not an audiophile, but I keep climbing the ladder toward better and better sound. I look for an emotional response to measure the music. I started with War's "The World is a Ghetto" and ended with Judy's "Over the Rainbow". I took another step on the ladder. Many of my songs are FLAC but I have a ton of ITunes music. I did get the Audioengine D1 premium 24-bit DAC. This made the PC game Dragon Age Inquisition sound amazing, and makes iTunes songs greatly improved.
customer_reviews.author: david mauger

customer_reviews.title: The wood finish is beautiful, and they sound clear
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a new Klipsch Pro Media 2.1 system with these...what a difference. I was worried about not having a subwoofer but these speakers don't need one. The wood finish is beautiful, and they sound clear, crisp and balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: a serious, yet graceful-looking set
customer_reviews.text: after having researched long for a quality pair of computer speakers i ended up buying this pair based on frequency specifications, weight and looks. mainly listening to classical music and i do believe this company found the ideal balance of quality of sound / size / price. the sound from the low frequencies to high feels continuous, fluid, smooth and true - and also with different volume settings. please note, as any self-respecting hi-fi company would, they are brave enough to print their frequency range - unlike BOSE, for instance. my other finalist was the B & W pair, and although i use their big siblings in my living room, their size and warming-up issue made me cautious. highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: afejer

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth works well and the sound quality is good. Using the 3.5mm jack cable and the sound is terrible but the speakers are meant for BT.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Schulman

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value
customer_reviews.text: I'm an audiophile with a 5-figure dedicated 2-channel stereo system in the living room. I bought these for my A/V system, partly to reduce clutter. These are nowhere near audiophile quality (sorry, AudioEngine, but that's pure marketing hype, i.e. a lie), but where else can you get a decent sounding preamp, amp, and a pair speakers for $400? I'm tickled with these, and perhaps even more so with the A2's.
customer_reviews.author: August West

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible speakers. They're a really high quality build and easy to set up - I'm using an aux to 2 male RCA cable to connect my computer. Even at less than half volume these guys are more than loud enough - anywhere near full volume on a bass-heavy track and my room is shaking! Straight out the box they give you fantastic punchy bass and clear, sharp highs. I've only had them a little while but I'm sure the sound will change a little bit once they're burned in too. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alex I

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but boring sound
customer_reviews.text: They're pretty but have ho-hum, almost non existent imaging; very plain sounding overall. The paired S8 or other sub is a must, these don't go low enough on their own. I got the bamboo ones and am a big fan of the build quality and color. Was a much bigger fan of my old Elac B6's and low end Yamaha receiver which all together cost about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Presence Unknown

customer_reviews.title: There are days at work where I'm excited to get home just to listen to music
customer_reviews.text: I am still blown away every time I listen to these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great When Paired with a Good DAC
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! I've had these on my "Wishlist" for over a year. When they went on an amazing sale last week, I couldn't resist. Well worth it, along with the D1 DAC!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, compact, self powered- and pretty
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with them. I choked at spending this much for two speakers, but I've decided that they were worth it. Had them for about a year. Sound great. Look great, small and fit where I want them. Don't have 144 small plastic computer speakers and all the wires running all over my desk for the typical computer speakers. If I need to be surrounded, I have headphones. They are my computer speakers, but that is where I usually listen to music these days. I've also packed them for a trip and they worked fine but I was a little paraniod about the exposed speaker grill, but they survived.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Sound and Quality are Awesome!!! Purchased January 13, 2020
customer_reviews.text: Had the A2+ Audioengine speakers system for years, based on that and the quality of service from Audioengine which cannot be beat! If you want a clear Bluetooth audio sound loud enough that you can dance to in any room, this is it! (These are my computer speakers system) Enjoy your Audioengine A5+ 150W Wireless Powered Bookshelf Speakers, Bluetooth for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Colon

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Now that I had these speakers for about a month, I can comfortably say that these are the best speakers for the price. I didn't want to over spend on Desktop speakers, but I care a lot about my music, so the $400 price tag was a happy medium of getting good quality speakers and not having to overspend to achieve said quality. If I could give them a six out of five stars, I would. Totally recommend them to anyone looking for an upgraded experience from your basic desktop speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance, tons of bass and high end clarity
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm kicking myself for not upgrading from some used M-Audios that I picked up opportunistically a long time ago. I plugged these in and was immediately blow away. Also bought the D1 DAC and together they are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: dyanacek

customer_reviews.title: I expected good computer speakers
customer_reviews.text: I expected good computer speakers. Each time I listen to these I am more impressed. I love many kinds of music and these do a great job on all. The sound quality is excellent and they just don't quit! Great speakers! And the company: I've owned their AW1 (transmitter/receiver) for a few years. I lost the transmitter. They said: "...send in what I have and they'll give me the new model for $40 (they sell for $150). I can't say enough about their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fab speakers! Just what the Dr. ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great speakers! I ordered, tested, and returned Audioengine A2+ because they just didn't give me the full sounds I was looking for. These A5+ fill the void and then some. World.Wide.Stereo did a great job with quick turnaround and shipping.
customer_reviews.author: japjoe7

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after admiring the sound they made at a friend's house, and I am not disappointed. I'm a music lover, and these reproduce music brilliantly. They can produce quite a bit of volume without distorting. The bass response is excellent for the size. I did eventually add a subwoofer (I like electronic music with a lot of bass) but honestly unless you are a bass-head, the bass these put out is actually quite impressive. I use this with an airport express in my living room so anyone can stream music to them.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Bustanoby

customer_reviews.title: Super sound - fills a large bedroom completely.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these today after decent research and have been listening for last 6 hours... Have listened to mozart, van morrison - best of, astral weeks and moondance, and a hindi album - rockstar so far. They sound amazing and are able to fill my master bedroom (about 20 ft by 40 ft) completely. Good hi fidelity quality for a reasonable price. Go for it. I have connected my logitech squeezebox thru a 3.5 mm cable and am playing my library in apple lossless format. The bamboo finish looks good with bedroom furniture. I would say these are no brainer in less than $ 500 category. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Pankaj Shukla

customer_reviews.title: sound great even at low volumes
customer_reviews.text: play loud if you want but sound great at low volumes next to your puter. glad I finally bought a pair to replace the store brand speakers that came with my puter. Not even broken in yet and they sound great. even has a remote
customer_reviews.author: J. Vachon

customer_reviews.title: I've had these speakers since 2013 and still Love them!
customer_reviews.text: The A5+ are actually my computer speakers. If you're really picky about sound quality these speakers will blow you away. Smooth, clear, clean, slightly warm and non fatiguing! I first had all my music on iTunes but switched to JRiver Media Center and what a difference that made!!! Yes iTunes is free but you get what you pay for ;)
customer_reviews.author: JohnPaul

customer_reviews.title: Great Things Do Come In Small Packages
customer_reviews.text: Small footprint large sound. These little speakers rock!! Added a sub woofer for more bass. Have yet to crank them to max. For my needs they fit the bill beyond my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Winston B. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Computer Powered Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Anyone interested in improving the sound of their computer speakers, go no further, I have tried several, including Klipsch and the Bose with the sub. This desktop pair, without a sub, in my opinion blows them away. I plan on adding the Audioengine matching sub, and I think most users will be satisfied without a sub. I did no scientific or other detailed testing, but just my opinion of what I am hearing. I see some other users have some very detailed reviews, so I would weigh them in also.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: At first I felt like there is not enough of a high tones in the music that was coming out of those speakers, but now I like it. The only annoying thing is a power switch on the back. Don't they know its hard to reach that spot? I am environmental friendly and don't want to use electricity when I don't need it. They look very nice, sound great. I don't think subwoofer is necessary addition. They cover low tones nicely, but it also depends on the size of a room where you gonna listen to the music. Buy with confidence if it is within your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Radek

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful speakers
customer_reviews.text: I did not know computer speakers could sound this good! Coming from a fairly good set (the Klipsch Pro Media 2.1), I can say that the A5+ is a step above my previous one. The sound is more balance compared to the Klipsch set, which was a bit bass heavy. These speakers are all around good and suitable for all kinds of music. The white set I bought looks great on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Doc

customer_reviews.title: Listening to these speakers as I type this review!
customer_reviews.text: I had my eyes on these speakers for a while, a couple of weeks ago i watched an "unbox therapy" video and I decided to give these a try. I am absolutely thrilled with my purchase, these speakers are amazing. I am actually hearing instruments that i didn't even know existed in the track. I decided to purchase the White Glossy Finish set, i was tired of the same old black speakers, I definitely recommend these speakers to anyone who desires to join the "Audio Revolution"
customer_reviews.author: TECHFIT360

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of audioengine speakers I bought for my home and I'm still not disappointed. Pricy than some other sets, but the balance is great and the real wood is wonderful compared to cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING speakers I can't even begin to tell you how amazing they sound.... It changed the way I lisiten to music honestly. I expected them to be smaller but they are HUGE so make sure you have space for them if you intend on buying it.. The looks and the sound are well worth the pricetag I'm looking foward to adding the subwoffer to this set piece.
customer_reviews.author: Sweta

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound and quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these speakers to replace a set of Corsair sp2500. I have owned several different brands of computer speakers and the performance of the A5 blows them all out of the water. Not only does it have clear highs and lows but the mid is present as well! I paired these with a Klipsch 10" sub and wow! Without the sub they were great with the added low frequency they are boss! Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John Nutter

customer_reviews.title: Impeccable sound quality
customer_reviews.text: As a videographer, Best speakers I've ever bought. Period. Make sure to buy the sub with it though, takes the sound to a whole new level.
customer_reviews.author: Trostle Films

customer_reviews.title: Great appearance, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Okay top notch! Great appearance, easy to set up.. .less space than the Logitech I had and performance is exceptional... moved away from my old amplifier and listening to more computer music with these... I would recommend the extra fee for the wood ones. Expensive but if you enjoy music, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Conangib

customer_reviews.title: not super impressed
customer_reviews.text: but willing to yolo on the sub. most the other reviews were written probably written by audiophiles. I am not one myself but I don't see much difference between these any similar (offbrand) speakers I found for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fake Made

customer_reviews.title: Unreal sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Audioengine A5+ Wireless in Bamboo. They're without a doubt the best pair of speakers I have ever owned. The sound and build quality is unmatched. If you're on the fence about buying, do it. You won't be disappointed and I plan to have these speakers till the day I die.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Stop Shopping and Start Listening
customer_reviews.text: OMG - these are everything that I expected and then some. You are wasting your time reading anymore reviews. These are the absolutely best $400 PC speakers on the face of the planet earth. I just can't wait for my wife to go out of the house because she can't take it - now that is all you need to know. Also, get a five caster chair, because these will knock you over !!
customer_reviews.author: R. Gehring

product_meta.title: Audioengine A5 Plus Classic 150W Powered Bookshelf Speakers with Remote Control, Built in Analog Amplifier - Black
feature_bullets: Built-in power amplifiers, 50 watt per channel RMS
Compatible with any computer (Mac or PC)
Custom Kevlar woofers and silk tweeters
Remote control, 1/8" and RCA inputs, USB power, all cables included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars980 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
